result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tondell Laron McNeely

Defendant Tondell Laron McNeely in court.  Attorney Scott Alan Wales Aty appeared by phone for Tondell Laron McNeely.  Attorney Kenneth Olstinski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm 
Case scheduled for Calendar Call this date.  Defendant appeared in person.  Court in trial on another matter.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Defendant given date slip. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tondell Laron McNeely in court with attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Samuel Tufford for Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Schedulling Conference held.  Defense requests adjourned scheduling date to allow him time to discuss possible DPA resolution with ADA Olstinski.  
  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tondell Laron McNeely in court with Attorney Scott Alan Wales.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tondell Laron McNeely in court, appear in person with attorney Scott Alan Wales, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Wales needs more time to meet with client.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tondell Laron McNeely in court.  Kenneth Olstinski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Case in Court for Indigency Hearing.  Court appoints counsel for defendant.  Attorney Scott Wales accepts appointment.  Court will discuss reimbursement to Milwaukee County for attorney fees at a later date.  Defense unable to appear on currently scheduled Preliminary Hearing date and requests adjournment.

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (4/30/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Prior: 8126 West Medford Avenue, #2, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.

Defendant Tondell Laron McNeely in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Indigency hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
